data.title: In Conversation with Lulu Wang
data.meta_description: One of the most exciting and resonant voices working in film and television today, director Lulu Wang broke onto the scene in 2019 with her sophomore feature The Farewell, which she wrote and directed. Wang went on to amass critical acclaim and awards, including Best Feature at the 2020 Independent Spirit Awards as well as an AFI Top Ten Films of 2019 selection, a Golden Globe Award nomination, and Best Feature and Best Screenplay nods from the Gotham Independent Film Awards. Wang's next project is Expats, an Amazon MGM Studios limited series adaptation of Janice Y. K.
data.text:
One of the most exciting and resonant voices working in film and television today, director Lulu Wang broke onto the scene in 2019 with her sophomore feature The Farewell, which she wrote and directed. Wang went on to amass critical acclaim and awards, including Best Feature at the 2020 Independent Spirit Awards as well as an AFI Top Ten Films of 2019 selection, a Golden Globe Award nomination, and Best Feature and Best Screenplay nods from the Gotham Independent Film Awards. Wang's next project is Expats, an Amazon MGM Studios limited series adaptation of Janice Y. K. Lee’s 2016 novel about a group of expatriates living in Hong Kong. Additionally, Wang's production company, Local Time, has several features, TV series, and podcasts in development, including the feature film Children of the New World with FilmNation based on Alexander Weinstein's short story of the same name. Local Time is also in production on a U.S. film adaptation of Hirokazu Kore-eda's Like Father Like Son with Focus Features.

This event is preceded by the Signature Screening of Expats.
